alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 5:53AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Wintry Weather Today and Cold Temperatures Tonight... A strong and unseasonably cold storm system will continue to affect the region this weekend. Scattered rain and snow showers are expected this morning into the early afternoon. Little to no snow accumulation is expected in most places. However, at 2500 feet elevation and above a dusting to an inch of snow is possible through this afternoon. From this morning through late this afternoon, the crest of Pine Mountain along the Little Shepherd Trail and Black Mountain could receive between 1 and 2 inches of snow. Slippery travel could occur at times on KY 160 between Lynch and the VA border. Precipitation ends late this afternoon into early this evening, with clearing skies expected late tonight and overnight. This will set up for temperatures near or below freezing by dawn on Sunday. Most places can expect frost at a minimum, and the possibility of temperatures dipping below 30 degrees, especially in the sheltered valleys.
